result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler Lee Buckles

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Tyler Lee Buckles appeared by video.  Attorney John C. Lillie III appeared by video for Tyler Lee Buckles.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on both counts.  Waives speedy trial demand. ADA Becker states all discovery has been sent but an offer needs to be sent still.  Atty Lillie makes statements.  Court schedules this matter out.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at  10:26 AM. bph
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Filed by ADA Becker. arc    e:Atty Lillie
Protective Order, signed by SRN on 9/30/22. bph
Protective order. Filed by ADA Becker. arc   to SRN
for Protective Order. Filed by ADA Becker. arc

4:01 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Tyler Lee Buckles in court.  Attorney John C. Lillie III in court for Tyler Lee Buckles.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file.  Atty Lillie states DE wants to waive prelim.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court advises DE on procedures for zoom. Bond continues. Adjourned at 4:09 PM. bph
Arraignment scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.

The original document was titled: Pretrial Assessment Report (sealed)
The original history event date is: 08-30-2022
Pretrial Assessment Report. Reviewed by SRN. SEALED w/ access to parties.  gll
Filed by Atty Lillie. arc   e: DA

Adjustment Number: 22A 088686,
Payable Number: 244269,
Receipt Number: 22R 011800,
Amount: $20.00

_X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant and/or  __ Surety
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1,000.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, E.D.W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:20 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Defendant Tyler Lee Buckles in court.  Attorney John C. Lillie III in court for Tyler Lee Buckles.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets PH. gll
